channel.title: Source Compiler Problems?
channel.description:
i continue to get an error that looks like this
Unrecognized option: -d Error: Could not create the Java Virtual Machine. Error: A fatal exception has occurred. Program will exit. Press any key to continue . . .
and this is what my compiler looks like
@echo off title Compile color 1E "C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin\java.exe" -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\clip\*.java src\server\clip\region\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\minigames\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java pause
if anyone knows the problem can you please help me out here

item.title: Source Compiler Problems?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“F A Y D, post:5, topic:544187”][quote author=The Web Guy link=topic=663069.msg4431381#msg4431381 date=1403383733]

Java is picky and case-sensitive. The c:\ needs to be capitalized (C:) ++ make sure that’s the right JDK version.
[/quote]

which JDK do i download? there are so many different ones, i have a 64 bit computer windows 8[/quote]

Try this one.

Read full topic

item.title: Source Compiler Problems?
item.dc:creator: @F_A_Y_D F A Y D
item.description:
@F_A_Y_D wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:4, topic:544187”]"c:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_60\bin\javac.exe"

Java is picky and case-sensitive. The c:\ needs to be capitalized (C:) ++ make sure that’s the right JDK version.[/quote]

which JDK do i download? there are so many different ones, i have a 64 bit computer windows 8

Read full topic

item.title: Source Compiler Problems?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:


Java is picky and case-sensitive. The c:\ needs to be capitalized (C:\) ++ make sure that's the right JDK version.

Java is picky and case-sensitive. The c:\ needs to be capitalized (C:) ++ make sure that’s the right JDK version.

Read full topic

item.title: Source Compiler Problems?
item.dc:creator: @F_A_Y_D F A Y D
item.description:
@F_A_Y_D wrote:

i changed it to
@echo off
title Compile
color 1E
"c:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_60\bin\javac.exe" -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event*.java src\server\clip*.java src\server\clip\region*.java src\server\model\items*.java src\server\model\minigames*.java src\server\model\npcs*.java src\server\model\objects*.java src\server\model\players*.java src\server\model\players\skills*.java src\server\model\players\packets*.java src\server\model\shops*.java src\server\net*.java src\server\util*.java src\server\world*.java src\server\util\log*.java src\server*.java
pause

and now im getting this error, which i feel like its because the numbers arent right?? idk becuase i just got the laptop two days ago and updated all my jres and java. but here is the error

The system cannot find the path specified.
Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

item.title: Source Compiler Problems?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

For a compiler, you shouldn’t be calling to the Java Runtime Environment, that’s for running Java applications. You want to call to the Java Development Kit (JDK), when you’re compiling. Go to C:/Program Files/Java/ and see if you have a folder that looks something like /jdk1.7.0_51/ if not, download JDK 8 from here and change this part:

to something along the lines of

Replace the pound symbols with whatever JDK version you have, if you can’t get it to work, reply here with what isn’t working.

Read full topic

item.title: Source Compiler Problems?
item.dc:creator: @F_A_Y_D F A Y D
item.description:
@F_A_Y_D wrote:

i continue to get an error that looks like this

Unrecognized option: -d
Error: Could not create the Java Virtual Machine.
Error: A fatal exception has occurred. Program will exit.
Press any key to continue . . .

and this is what my compiler looks like

@echo off
title Compile
color 1E
"C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin\java.exe" -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event*.java src\server\clip*.java src\server\clip\region*.java src\server\model\items*.java src\server\model\minigames*.java src\server\model\npcs*.java src\server\model\objects*.java src\server\model\players*.java src\server\model\players\skills*.java src\server\model\players\packets*.java src\server\model\shops*.java src\server\net*.java src\server\util*.java src\server\world*.java src\server\util\log*.java src\server*.java
pause

if anyone knows the problem can you please help me out here
